title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that diminishing marginal returns with the fourth worker and/or does not explain that the marginal product (MP) of the fourth worker (8) was less than the MP of the third worker (9).
The response states that diminishing marginal returns begin with the fourth worker and explains that the marginal product (MP) of the fourth worker (8) was less than the MP of the third worker (9).

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the marginal revenue product of the sixth worker as $32 and/or does not show the work.

MRP=P×MP=$8×4=$32 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@468C@

The response calculates the marginal revenue product of the sixth worker as $32 and shows the work.

MRP=P×MP=$8×4=$32 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@468C@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that 7 workers will be hired to maximize its profit and/or does not explain that the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the 7th worker ($16) is greater than the marginal resource cost (MRC) or wage ($15), but the MRP of the 8th worker ( −$8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaGGKaGaaGioaaaa@3B53@ ) is less than the MRC ($15).

The response states that 7 workers will be hired to maximize its profit and explains that the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the 7th worker ($16) is greater than the marginal resource cost (MRC) or wage ($15), but the MRP of the 8th worker ( −$8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaGGKaGaaGioaaaa@3B53@ ) is less than the MRC ($15).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· States that the number of workers hired in the labor market will increase and explains that an increase in the productivity of workers will increase the demand for labor in the market for cooks.

· States that the wage rate Denice’s Diner will pay will increase and explains that the increase in the market demand for labor will increase the market wage, which increases the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.

The response does one of the following:

· States that the number of workers hired in the labor market will increase and explains that an increase in the productivity of workers will increase the demand for labor in the market for cooks.

· States that the wage rate Denice’s Diner will pay will increase and explains that the increase in the market demand for labor will increase the market wage, which increases the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.

The response does both of the following:

· States that the number of workers hired in the labor market will increase and explains that an increase in the productivity of workers will increase the demand for labor in the market for cooks.

· States that the wage rate Denice’s Diner will pay will increase and explains that the increase in the market demand for labor will increase the market wage, which increases the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.
